alert.note: Alert for Henderson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 11 at 7:44PM EST until November 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Central Henderson County, North Carolina * WHEN...Until 100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas including farmland, parks, greenways, nurseries, low-water crossings, golf courses, and low-lying roadways adjacent to streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 739 PM EST, Storm-total rainfall of 2-4" within the Mud Creek watershed of central Henderson County resulted in significant rises along Mud Creek and its tributaries. Heavy rainfall ended across the area several hours ago and the floodwave is moving past the Hendersonville area. Mud Creek crested at 9.54 feet between 2 and 3 pm at Erkwood Dr and will crest downstream at N Main St over the next couple of hours. Mud Creek remains above Action/Advisory Stage and continues to impact farmland, nurseries, and golf courses near Crail Farm Rd, Middleton Rd, Erkwood Dr, and Kanuga Rd as well as the Oklawaha Greenway. It will take several more hours for Mud Creek to recede below bankfull or Action/Advisory Stage. Flooding impacts will continue but gradually improve into the early overnight hours. The Flood Advisory will remain in effect until the stream falls below Action/Advisory Stage. - Some locations that may continue to experience flooding include... Hendersonville and Mountain Home. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
